21 Jul 2011

Barry says “Social Media is Gouda”

By in category

In a couple of weeks, agronomists, food scientists, cheesemakers and cheesemongers will be joined by one serious cheese loving social marketing guy. On August 3rd, Barry will be delivering a presentation on social media at the American Cheese Society Conference in Montréal.

This is the conference’s 28th year, but it’s the first time the event is being held outside the U.S. That’s a nice nod to Montréal’s cheese making chops.

Montreal, cheese & social media–the perfect match for Barry who was born on the island, and raised by a Hungarian father who immigrated to Montréal and calls Roquefort “The cheese of the kings and the king of cheeses” every time he serves up a cheese platter. Barry comes by his love of cheese naturally.

Barry tweeting while munching on artisan smoked gouda

Barry will be helping folks in the cheese biz learn how to use social more strategically. Barry’s going help these passionate folks learn how to leverage what the do, know and care about to connect to equally passionate online audiences.

Here are some interesting facts that might lure you to attend the 2011 American Cheese Conference

  • 2: The number of official cheesemongers whose job it is handle the cheeses during the cheese show
  • 44: The number of speakers making presentations during the conference
  • 1,400: The number of artisan, farmstead, and specialty cheeses being featured at the Festival of Cheeses
  • 99: The number of categories of ACS recognizes for master of cheese making
  • 16: The number of scholarships awarded to cheesemakers, chefs and students to attend this year’s conference

The American Cheese Society put together a little video on selecting Montreal as the site for this year’s cheese festival.  It includes a cute animated short about Montréal’s cheese history. The rest is a bit cheesy,but what do you expect?

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
